meanings.definition: Not real or actual; imaginary or unreal.
meanings.sent1: The irreal world in the story was full of magical creatures.
meanings.sent2: Her dreams often took her to an irreal place where anything was possible.
meanings.sent3: In the irreal land of make-believe, the trees could talk and the rivers flowed with chocolate.
meanings.sent4: The irreal nature of the situation made it hard to believe it was happening in real life.
meanings.sent5: The irreal castle shimmered in the distance, like a mirage in the desert.

meanings.sent1: The magician's irreal tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The mirage in the desert was an irreal image that disappeared as they got closer.
meanings.sent3: The irreal promise of eternal youth turned out to be a scam.
meanings.sent4: The irreal world of virtual reality felt almost too real to be true.
meanings.sent5: The irreal painting seemed to come to life, its colors dancing on the canvas.
